column5: Since Gilford is not quite ready! I decided to make another trip East to Port Bolster. It was -15'C when I arrived at Casey's, Clear skies and zero wind  The access to the Lake was good a little rough but no slush or water. The area that was broken/busted up ice has been smoothed out with the warm temps and rain.  I drilled holes in 3 spots and all were 6-7"  The water today was not very clear and you could only see down about 8' So I ended up catching a lot of dinks but there were plenty of quality fish mixed in. The Pan Slammer on a drop shot, the Slab Grabber, and the Buckshot Forage Minnow put the bigger fish on the Ice.   I am trying to figure out how to load some pics.  I see in PB my pics are 4000w X 3000H  What size should I make them to upload?  Until then!!  Have Fun See Ya on the Hard Stuff  Rick
If u have a photobucket or similar image hosting account. You can use the direct Link feature to insert your pictures into your post
I think I got it  LOL
I want to head out right now.  If I leave I can get in at least an hours worth of fishing.lol
Good stuff Rick.  I'm itching to get up there but given that I have limited opportunities I'm going to wait for safe ice over deep water.
Nice catch Rick , they look to be a nice size too .
